__TOC__



Here we have a sampling of bugs to work on for Hug Day.  After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after "background-color:" and before ";".  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been hugged.  

You might find it more convenient to edit the wiki page using <code>editmoin</code> a command line utility for editing moinmoin wiki pages.  It is available as a package in Gutsy and Hardy.  More information including an easier way to do this was <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-bugsquad/2007-November/000666.html|mailed]]</nowiki> to the Bug Squad. 

=== 5-a-day-ing ===

During hug days you can also do <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/5-A-Day|5-A-Day]]</nowiki> for this one you can do the following in order to tag your work on the hug day:
 
* 5-a-day --add-tag hugday-20080603
* Add bugs to 5-a-day as usual 
* And when done with hug day run: 5-a-day --remove-tag hugday-20080603

More information about <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/5-A-Day#Tag|tags here]]</nowiki>.

=== 50 Newest bugs ===
These bugs have been reported about Ubuntu in general but do not have a software package associated with them, subsequently they are unlikely to be looked at by a developer.  We can help easily help these bug reports through the process by assigning a package to them.  Even better follow up with the reporter if necessary.  More of these bugs can be found with <nowiki>[[http://tinyurl.com/22gw9k|this]]</nowiki> bug query.

Help regarding which package to choose can be found at <nowiki>[[Bugs/FindRightPackage]]</nowiki> and a list of wiki pages regarding how to debug specific packages and subsystems can be found at DebuggingProcedures.

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* At a minimum assign the bug to a package so it has a better change of getting attention '''or'''
* Assign a package '''and''' ask for more information and set the bug's status to Incomplete '''or'''
* If the bug is not a bug but a support request convert the bug to a question '''or'''
* If it is a bug about something needing to be packaged - tag the bug as 'needs-packaging' prepend '[needs-packaging]' to the summary and set the status to Confirmed and importance to Wishlist
